item.title: Expanding the Maritime Environmental and Technical Assistance Program

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation.

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

summary.text:
Expanding the Maritime Environmental and Technical Assistance Program

This bill authorizes appropriations to support the maritime environmental and technical assistance program of the U.S. Maritime Administration, including activities related to technologies that support port and vessel air emissions reductions and to support zero emissions technologies.

Additionally, activities shall be used to inform the policy decisions of the United States related to domestic regulations and to the United States position on matters before the International Maritime Organization.

bill.title: Expanding the Maritime Environmental and Technical Assistance Program

item.title: Expanding the Maritime Environmental and Technical Assistance Program
Expanding the Maritime Environmental and Technical Assistance Program
A bill to authorize appropriations for the maritime environmental and technical assistance program, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
